definition: (old) grandfather/polite address for an elderly man, or a woman's father-in-law/(Taiwanese) grandfather
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: His father knew it , but his grandma doted on him.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲知道这一点，可他的阿公母仍然宠着他。

sentences.english: ChuDianZi help the Kenyan extension sea conception has herod the birthday of the gift.
sentences.chinese: 阿公出点子帮著拓海构思有希的华诞礼物。

sentences.english: The grandpa's few words wiped away decades of resentment.
sentences.chinese: 阿公轻轻一句话，把所有几十年的怨都抹消掉了。

sentences.english: Around this time Audrey was toddling around behind Grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 这时小贝贝跟著阿公东看西看。

sentences.english: Yong Kenyan tourism footprint spans the globe.
sentences.chinese: 王勇阿公旅游脚印遍及全球。

sentences.english: FeiEr film role, but miss and see my grandfather last side.
sentences.chinese: 非儿获得电影角色，却错失和阿公见最后一面的机会。

definition: grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
aunt by marriage/husband's aunt/husband's father's younger brother's wife
grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
uncle (polite form of address for older male)
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
